title: Report and BWC from Firearm Discharge in Hotel

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

On January 20, 2026 the Minnesota Star Tribune published an article titled "ICE agent accidentally fires gun into Eagan hotel room." To assist with your search, the article included: "The gunshot occurred Dec. 18, at the Hampton Inn Minneapolis-Eagan, located at 3000 Eagandale Place."

We are seeking additional information on this accidental discharge. Please provide the following records:
1) Police report and related supplements and media (photos/videos)
2) 911 Call Audio related to the incident 
3) BWC for responding officer(s)
4) Any interview transcripts or recordings (if separate from #1. If they are included in #1 then please ignore this line)

Thank you for taking the time to fulfill this request. Please feel free to send any of the above items as they become available, they do not all need to be sent at once.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Alan J. Segal

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: To Date, 2025-2026 School Assignment
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

In the CPS Procedural Manual, it states, "The IEP team then submits a school assignment request to ODLSS to provide the appropriate school closest to the student’s residence that can implement the IEP."

Provide records sufficient to show the following:

1. Anonymized data of all school assignment requests made on behalf of CPS students with IEPs requiring placement for the 2025-2026 (to date) school year. These records should include a unique non-identifiable code for the student, the date their IEP was finalized, the date the school assignment request was made, the date the school assignment letter was issued, and the date the student enrolled.

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Flock Safety Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) I request internal training materials for the use of "Flock Safety" tools.

2) I request policies and procedures for the use of Flock tools

3) I request any sharing agreements signed with other agencies as well as department's sharing agreement it requires other agencies to conform to.

4) I request the web address of the department's "Flock Safety" transparency portal if activated. This is a free feature of Flock. This is not an add-on or analytics subscription.

5) Lastly, I request all available audit data from the "Flock" audit tools. This should include the organization audit, network audit, and sharing report.
    A. Organization Audit in Flock.
    The report should include data logged from the period of installation to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done by the City.

    B. Network Audit in Flock.
    The report should include data logged from the period of installation, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the City’s Flock network by any agency the City has shared with in the Flock System.

    C. Sharing report in Flock.
    The report should include flock networks shared with The City and networks The City is sharing its network with.

Flock maintains documentation on these reports. Flock documentation says the reports can be pulled in 31 day increments.  Flock also says that customers may want to contact support for requests longer than six months or for large accounts. If production of audit logs requires support from Flock, please declare such needs and have the City's point person on the Flock support ticket provide updates on their progress.  Please note that license plate numbers are public information or it would be unsafe to display them. Drivers would also be able to hide their plates in their trunk if they were meant to be private.  Officer usernames are similarly publicly available by many resources, such as news reports, court cases, case notes, and reports.

I request that files be supplied in their original electronic, machine readable format rather than being converted to any alternate formats. Where multiple formats are available for export, I request csv, xls, or other spreadsheet compatible formats.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

These records were initially requested from the City of Joplin.  They have directed me to you.

The last three audits of Joplin Police Department's access to MULES and NCIC systems conducted under CJIS standards or other requirements. This should include things such as dates, reports, anomalies investigated, whether such anomalies were cleared or sustained, pass/fail results for the department, and the auditor who performed the audit.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: DHS requests for assistance.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like a copy of any request for assistance from the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or agency thereunder to the San Luis Obispo Police Department for year 2025. 
Further, I would I copy of any and all correspondence from San Luis Obispo Police Department (SLOPD) to DHS or any agency thereunder responding to any request for assistance from DHS or any agency thereunder for year 2025. 

Lastly, I would like a copy of any email or recording that is involved in deliberation "determining whether the requested assistance would be permitted under the California Values Act (Government Code § 7284.2 et seq.)" by any SLOPD supervisor involved in doing so in 2025. 

For purposes of indemnification, any deliberative process determining whether a local police department can meld itself with a federal agency in immigration raids, sweeps, and in my case, unwarranted detention, is going to be documented. I am requesting this material as a PRA request. 

"414.6 FEDERAL REQUESTS FOR ASSISTANCE
Requests by federal immigration officials for assistance from this department should be directed
to a supervisor. The supervisor is responsible for determining whether the requested assistance
would be permitted under the California Values Act (Government Code § 7284.2 et seq.)."
[San Luis Obispo Police Department Policies and Procedures manual]

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Shawn Harris

title: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Town of Moorefield FOIA Spring 2026

communications.subject: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Town of Moorefield FOIA Spring 2026
communications.communication:
Jessica Riley 
1511 University Avenue, P.O. Box 6010
Morgantown, WV 26506-6010
January 22, 2026 

Rick Freeman, City Clerk
Moorefield Town Hall
206 Winchester Avenue
Moorefield, WV 26836

Dear Rick Freeman, 


Under the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, §29-B-1-1 et seq., I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records that pertain to Moorefield City’s opioid settlement funds. Specifically, I am requesting: 
- Documentation of the amount of funds the city has received from the federal opioid lawsuit settlements
- The application forms that any organization would submit to receive settlement funds
- Documentation of how much city-level funding has been awarded as of March 1, 2025, and to whom it was awarded
- Any completed application of an organization that has received settlement funds from the city
- Documentation of the process by which funds are awarded
- Any documents that contain the names of the individuals who review the funding applications and determine the awards
- Any documents that account for future plans from the city for the use of opioid settlement funds
If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $25. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of how the opioid settlement funds are being spent. I am a student journalist whose request is strictly for news-gathering purposes. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes. 
The West Virginia Freedom of Information Act requires a response to this request be made within five business days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than this amount of time, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records. 
If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law. 

Thank you for considering my request. 
Sincerely, Jessica Riley 
330-978-8228
jlr00026@mix.wvu.edu

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Rifaat al Assad
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Syrian military officer Rifaat Ali al Assad (22 August 1937 – 20 January 2026). His name is spelled رِفْعَتُ عَلِيِّ ٱلْأَسَدِ in Arabic. His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2026/01/21/world/middleeast/rifaat-al-assad-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.subject: Formal Acknowledgement | Georgia Open Records Act Request: Qualified Caregiving Expense Credit Tax Statistics
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting the Georgia Department of Revenue. Please allow this to serve as the Department's initial response to and formal acknowledgement of your open records request.

The Department will attempt to provide all requested records, but due to confidentiality law, it is possible that some items may not be disclosed. Pursuant to O.C.G.A. § 50-18-70 et seq., the Department will provide our formal response within 10 business days.

Under Georgia law, an agency may impose a reasonable charge for the search, redaction, and production or copying cost of records responsive to an Open Records Request. The time and cost will be calculated by using the hourly salary of the lowest paid employee qualified to conduct the research of an Open Records Request, with no charge for the first fifteen minutes of employee time expended. DOR will provide an estimate to the requestor if the reasonably anticipated costs for Production Tasks exceed $25 and will defer the Production Tasks until the requestor agrees to pay estimated costs.

communications.subject: WDH Public Records Request: PREP Records
communications.communication:
Hello,

The Wyoming Department of Health (WDH) has received your public records
request, given the unique identifier PRR-26-010. The date of receipt is
January 22, 2026.

Please be advised that the Office of Privacy, Security, and Contracts
(OPSC) will coordinate your request.  The following steps are customarily
associated with the processing of a public records request. The process may
vary depending on the nature and availability of the information requested:

   1. Pursuant to Wyoming law, the OPSC sends an acknowledgment to the
   requestor upon receipt of the public records request.
   2. The OPSC identifies the relevant WDH division, program, or facility
   to process the request and asks it to provide an estimate of the labor,
   copies, and other reasonable cost-based fees required to process the
   request.
   3. The OPSC, upon receiving the estimate from the WDH division, program,
   or facility, sends the cost estimate to the requestor. At this point, the
   requestor can choose to modify the request, cancel the request, or agree to
   pay the fees associated with the request.
   4. Upon receiving the requestor's payment, the OPSC notifies the WDH
   division, program, or facility to process and provide the records to the
   OPSC.
   5. The OPSC, upon receiving the records, will provide the requestor with
   these records, if available.

The WDH strives to process public records requests as efficiently and
expeditiously as possible. Every effort will be made to respond to the
requesting party within thirty (30) days.

The WDH may request clarification if your request is unclear. If the
requested records are releasable, the next correspondence you will receive
from the WDH will be either a cost estimate letter seeking your agreement
to the costs associated with processing the request or, if your request is
minimal, the records themselves. If the requested records are *not* releasable
(i.e., the WDH does not have the requested records or cannot release the
requested records), it will provide you with notice of such denial.

Thank you.
-- 
*Office of Privacy, Security, and Contracts*
Wyoming Department of Health
401 Hathaway Building
Cheyenne, WY 82002

-- 

E-Mail to and from me, in connection with the transaction 
of public 
business, is subject to the Wyoming Public Records 
Act and may be 
disclosed to third parties.

communications.subject: Re: WDH Public Records Request: PREP Records
communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Garnand,

Please find attached the documents responsive to Part 1 of your public
records request (PRR-26-010) for information, quoted and organized as
follows:

*Part 1: **Communications and correspondence with the U.S. Department of
Health and Human Services regarding the Aug. 26, 2025, HHS letter
requesting the Wyoming Department of Health remove content from the state's
Personal Responsibility Education Program curricula and program materials.
For reference, the letter can be found here: *
https://acf.gov/sites/default/files/documents/main/08.26.25-Combined-PREP-Letters.pdf
*.*

*Part 2:** I also request internal communications between any Wyoming
Department of Health employees about the aforementioned letter. If the
content changes were made, I request a copy of the material before it was
changed as well as a copy of the material after it was changed.*
Part 2 of your request is being denied on the basis that these
communications and drafts are predecisional and deliberative, as the final
curricula have not received approval yet. The documents referenced in the
October 24, 2025, email titled "Wyoming curriculum review" are also being
withheld for these reasons. In the spirit of transparency, I have included
the WyPREP Cover Letter and two emails with HHS regarding our submission of
the curricula for review.

A new request will need to be submitted to obtain a copy of the final
curriculum after it has received approval. We do not have an estimate of
when we will receive that approval.

Please let me know if you have any additional questions.

Thank you,

Lindsay Mills
-- 
*Office of Privacy, Security, and Contracts*
Wyoming Department of Health
401 Hathaway Building
Cheyenne, WY 82002

-- 

E-Mail to and from me, in connection with the transaction 
of public 
business, is subject to the Wyoming Public Records 
Act and may be 
disclosed to third parties.

communications.subject: Re: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: West Virginia HHS response
communications.communication:
Due to the passage of HB 2006 during the 2023 Legislative session, and Governor Jim Justice signing the bill into law on March 4, 2023, the WV Dept. of Health and Human Resources was divided into three separate departments effective January 1, 2024, the Department of Health (DH), Department of Health Facilities (DHF) and Department of Human Services (DoHS).  

You have reached the Department of Human Services. If you are requesting public records maintained by this Department, a formal response will be forthcoming. If your request involves the Department of Health, your requests can be sent to DHFOIA@wv.gov, or if it is for the Department of Health Facilities, you requests can be sent to DHFFOIA@wv.gov.

Please be advised that this inbox does not serve as a clearinghouse for all public records maintained by government entities in West Virginia. 

If you have submitted a request for records that are outside our scope of authority to the Department of Human Services, you will receive no further communication from DoHSFOIA@wv.gov.

Communications and correspondence with the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services regarding the Aug. 26, 2025, HHS letter requesting the Tennessee Department of Children's Services remove content from the state's Personal Responsibility Education Program curricula and program materials. For reference, the letter can be found here: https://acf.gov/sites/default/files/documents/main/08.26.25-Combined-PREP-Letters.pdf.

I also request internal communications between any Tennessee Department of Children's Services employees about the aforementioned letter. If the content changes were made, I request a copy of the material before it was changed as well as a copy of the material after it was changed.

I additionally request that, if possible, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Ileana Garnand.
